text:
February 22, 1957
Dr* Burton Paulu
KU OK, One Eddy Hall
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton:
On No. 5 - NBC VP.
Joseph Hefferaan, NBC VP in New York, had written me
sometime ago, asked me to talk with him in Washington or Chicago.
He called me in Washington, from New York 12 days ago, and asked
me to come see him when in New York. I explained that you were
president, I a past president. I also explained my views, and
urged him to talk with you, since, on principle, I opposed what
he wanted me to do anyhow. That made him all the more Insistent
on talking with me.
What he wanted (and he started in on how he was so glad we
were to get NBC shows, l.e., NBC-ETRC; I immediately found out he
knew little late dope, because WILL-TV is one of three which must
get them via kine. No network facilities available) was to get
me to testify before a Congressional committee urging exemption of
all-channel receivers from excise tax. I said I did not oppose
exemption of all TV sets from excise tax, but that wouldn*t help
the UHF-VHF problem, and that taking off one, UHF, was like taking
off Dodge so Dodge could compete with Ford, Chevy, and Plymouth.
It was a pleasant, but hectic 20 minutes.
I had b; en warned by a man high in Industry that he, Heffeman,
was quite an operator. I had discussed problem with Lenny Marks
a week earlier.
Actually, little likelihood that Congress will act along
these lines anyhow.
Regards,
Frank E. Schooley
